reviews.review_msg: Betty is a very kind, respected prof and I quite enjoy our synchronous lectures (taking it online). That being said, she gives difficult assignments with very little instructions and grades tough. I would recommend her but be prepared to work really hard on all your papers for only an okay grade.

This class is incredibly hard and complex. Betty is a very sweet lady but she expects way TOO much from her undergraduate students. Having a night 4 hours lecture has never been easy but this one exceeds boredom. She is a very though grader. Also, the class is supposed to be about the 18th century authors and we never discussed about them. Awful.
Betty is a good prof. Her curriculum can be sort of inflexible, but she is a fair marker and gives really useful feedback. You can tell she cares about the students.

Paul was my instructor in his first year at SFU.  He taught the obligatory Commonwealth Lit and Can Lit that none of the American teachers wanted to teach.  Paul was fantastic then, and full of new ideas and interest.  It sounds like he is still teaching fresh ideas and giving those amazing critiques to assignments.

Awesome professor and not as scary as others seem to make her out to be. She has a cool lecture style and it's obvious to tell that she is passionate about what she does. Extremely willing to help students and provides very helpful feedback for assignments. While her grading can be tough, I think it is quite fair.

I liked this prof.  She's a fair marker and her evaluation components are easier and more interesting than the usual Engl course.  However, I wouldn't participate in her classes as she can really cut you down.  Even her remarks on assignments are often quite harsh.
fun, interesting, stimulating class with quirky prof who expends enormous effort and preparation for her classes
